subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 12 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Benitez responds to Mourinho jibe
Liverpool boss Rafael Benitez cranks up his war of words with Chelsea's Jose Mourinho ahead of their Champions League semi-final.



 
Bellamy targets semi-final return
Liverpool hope striker Craig Bellamy will have recovered from his knee injury in time to play against Chelsea in their Champions League semi-final.



 
Bayern may agree Hargreaves sale
Bayern Munich president Franz Beckenbauer says England's Owen Hargreaves could be allowed to join Man Utd this summer.








GOLF




Huang and Jacquelin lead in China
Raphael Jacquelin and local hope Ming-Jie Huang lead the China Open after a windy opening day in Shanghai.



 
Verizon Heritage leaderboard
Latest scores from the PGA Tour event in Harbour Town.



 
China Open leaderboard
The latest scores from the European Tour event in Shanghai.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton seeks to make F1 history
Lewis Hamilton could make Formula One history by claiming a third consecutive podium finish in Sunday's Bahrain Grand Prix.



 
Raikkonen up to speed for Bahrain
Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen hopes to have put his engine problems behind him in time for this weekend's race in Bahrain.



 
Hodgson secures Ducati test ride
Neil Hodgson is to be an official test rider for Ducati.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton seeks to make F1 history
Lewis Hamilton could make Formula One history by claiming a third consecutive podium finish in Sunday's Bahrain Grand Prix.



 
Raikkonen up to speed for Bahrain
Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen hopes to have put his engine problems behind him in time for this weekend's race in Bahrain.



 
Todt would welcome Brawn return
Ferrari chief Jean Todt says the team has first refusal if former technical boss Ross Brawn decides to return to Formula One.








ATHLETICS




Liu signs up to run in British GP
China's Olympic 110m hurdles champion and world record holder Liu Xiang will compete in the British Grand Prix in Sheffield in July.



 
Jones takes Irish Athletics role
Former UK Athletics performance director Max Jones is appointed as Ireland's director of athletics.



 
Sprinter pleads guilty to fraud
Former 100m world record-holder Tim Montgomery pleads guilty on charges of  fraud in the US.








CYCLING




Hammond takes second in Belgium
Britain's Roger Hammond finished in second place in the Gent-Wevelgem one-day classic in Belgium.



 
Cooke powers to Belgium victory
Welsh cyclist Nicole Cooke wins the Tour of Flanders to extend her World Cup lead.



 
GB reveal World Cup cycling team
Great Britain name an experienced 10-man team for next month's Paralympic World Cup in Manchester.
